{{Infobox single | Name = Sexy Bitch | Cover = Sexy Bitch cover.png | Artist = [[David Guetta]] featuring [[Akon]] | Album = [[One Love (David Guetta album)|One Love]] | Released = 26 July 2009 | Format = {{hlist|[[Gramophone record|12"]]|[[CD single|CD]]|[[music download|digital download]]}} | Recorded = 2009 | Genre = [[Electro hop music|Electro-hop]]{{cite web|url=http://www.rap-up.com/2009/07/20/new-music-david-guetta-f-akon-sexy-bitch/|title=New Music: David Guetta f/ Akon – ‘Sexy Bitch’|publisher=[[Rap-Up]] |accessdate=June 20, 2014 }} | Length = 3:14 | Label = {{hlist|[[Virgin Records|Virgin]]|[[EMI]]}} | Writer = {{hlist|[[Akon|Aliaune Thiam]]|[[David Guetta]]|Jean-Claude Sindres|Sandy Vee}} | Producer = David Guetta | Chronology = [[David Guetta]] singles | Last single = "[[When Love Takes Over]]"
(2009) | This single = "'''Sexy Bitch'''"
(2009) | Next single = "[[Grrrr (David Guetta song)|GRRRR]]"
(2009) | Misc = {{Extra chronology | artist = [[Akon]] | type = singles | prev_title = [[We Don't Care (Akon song)|We Don't Care]] | prev_year = 2009 | title = Sexy Bitch | year = 2009 | next_title = [[Let's Get Crazy (Cassie song)|Let's Get Crazy]] | next_year = 2009 }} }} "'''Sexy Bitch'''" (also known as "'''Sexy Chick'''" in clean versions) is a song by French [[Disc jockey|DJ]] [[David Guetta]] recorded for his fourth studio album ''[[One Love (David Guetta album)|One Love]]'' (2009). The song features vocals from Senegalese-American recording artist [[Akon]]. It was released as the second single from ''One Love'' internationally. The song was serviced to [[Contemporary hit radio|mainstream]] and [[rhythmic crossover]] radios on 1 September 2009 in the United States, through [[Astralwerks]], together with [[Capitol Records]]. It was written by Giorgio Tuinfort, Aliaune Thiam, David Guetta, Jean-Claude Sindres and [[Sandy Vee]]; the latter three also produced the song. The song was made in one night after the two main artists met at a concert. The lyrics of "Sexy Bitch" deal with the protagonist's infatuation with a woman. "Sexy Bitch" garnered generally mixed to positive reviews from music critics, who commended the song's production. The song achieved commercial success worldwide, peaking inside the top five in several countries, including topping the charts in Australia, Austria, Canada, Germany, New Zealand, and the United Kingdom. "Sexy Bitch" peaked at number five on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] and became Guetta's first top five hit in the United States. The song also became his best selling song in the United States, earning a triple platinum certification by the [[Recording Industry Association of America]] (RIAA), with sales of 3,507,000 copies as of March 2014. The music video for "Sexy Bitch" features Guetta and Akon at a house party and performing in a concert. ==Background and release== "Sexy Bitch" was written by Giorgio Tuinfort, [[Akon|Aliaune Thiam]], [[David Guetta]], Jean-Claude Sindres and [[Sandy Vee]]. The production was helmed by Guetta, Sindres and Vee. Guetta, in an interview for [[MTV News]], said the collaboration with Akon came after they met during a performance of "[[When Love Takes Over]]" with [[Kelly Rowland]]. Akon approached him, asking if they could work together, and Guetta suggested that they should start immediately, so they rented a studio in London and made the song in one night.{{cite web|title=Guetta Talks 'Sexy Chick' |url=http://923now.cbslocal.com/2010/01/26/guetta-talks-sexy-chick/ |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120701141507/http://923now.cbslocal.com/2010/01/26/guetta-talks-sexy-chick/ |dead-url=yes |archive-date=July 1, 2012 |work=New York's 92.3 NOW |publisher=CBS Local Media |accessdate=31 May 2012 |date=January 26, 2010 }} "Sexy Bitch" was released as the second single from ''[[One Love (David Guetta album)|One Love]]'' (2009), after the international success of "When Love Takes Over". It was released worldwide as a digital promotional single, which preceded the release ''One Love'', on 24 July 2009.{{cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/sexy-bitch-feat.-akon-single/id324150413 |title=Sexy Bitch (feat. Akon) - Single by Rihanna |publisher=iTunes (GB). Apple |accessdate=2012-05-28 }}{{dead link|date=May 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} [[Astralwerks]], together with [[Capitol Records]], solicited the song to mainstream and rhythmic radios on 1 September 2009 in the United States under the name "Sexy Chick".{{cite web|title=Airplay Archive|url=http://fmqb.com/Article.asp?id=69239|work=[[FMQB]]|publisher=Friday Morning Quarterback Album Report, Inc. and Mediaspan Online Services|accessdate=15 May 2012}} On 7 September 2009, an extended play was serviced to digital retailers, containing an extended version of the song and two remixes by Chuckie, Lil Jon and Koen Groeneveld.{{cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/sexy-bitch-feat.-akon-ep/id378109333 |title=Sexy Bitch (feat. Akon) - EP by David Guetta |publisher=iTunes (US). Apple |accessdate=2012-05-28 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150304061432/https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/sexy-bitch-feat.-akon-ep/id378109333 |archivedate=2015-03-04 |df= }} That same day, a remixes extended play was released featuring remixes by disc jockeys Afrojack, Abel Ramos, and Groeneveld.{{cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/sexy-bitch-remixes-2-feat./id378110698 |title=Sexy Bitch (Remixes 2) [feat. Akon] - EP by David Guetta |publisher=iTunes (US). Apple |accessdate=2012-05-28 }}{{dead link|date=May 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} On 13 September 2009, an extended play of "Sexy Bitch" was released in the United Kingdom featuring the clean edit and remixes by DJ Footloose, Chuckie, Lil Jon, Abel Ramos, and Groeneveld.{{cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/sexy-chick-feat.-akon/id331381416 |title=Sexy Bitch (feat. Akon) by David Guetta |publisher=iTunes (GB). Apple |accessdate=2012-05-28 }}{{dead link|date=May 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} ==Composition== "Sexy Bitch" runs for 3 minutes and 14 seconds. It features a driving, [[8-bit (music)|8-bit]] style beat. According to the digital music sheet published at Musicnotes.com by [[Faber Music]], the song is written in a [[Key note|key]] of [[B minor]]. It is set in common time with a fast tempo of 130 beats per minute. Akon's vocals range from a high note of [[B (musical note)|B]]3 to a low note of [[G (musical note)|G]]5. The song has a basic accompaniment pattern consisting of [[open fifth]]s instead of chords, in a pattern of B5-D5-G5-D5-E5.{{cite web|title=David Guetta - Sexy Bitch Sheet Music (Digital Download)|url=http://www.musicnotes.com/sheetmusic/mtdFPE.asp?ppn=MN0082531&|publisher=Musicnotes.com|accessdate=29 May 2012}} The lyrics deal with the protagonist's infatuation with a female, demonstrated in lines like "I'm trying to find the words to describe this girl without being disrespectful," and "nothing like the neighbourhood whore". Eric Lyndal Martin of ''[[PopMatters]]'' commented that the song's lines would serve best in "Take Back the Night" ballads than on electronica songs. ==Critical reception== Michael Menachem of ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' praised the song, writing "Don't be surprised if this track takes over dancefloors as the summer ends."{{cite web|last=Menachem|first=Michael|title=David Guetta Featuring Akon, "Sexy Bitch"|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/review/1070978/david-guetta-featuring-akon-sexy-bitch|work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|accessdate=28 May 2012|date=August 18, 2009}} Nick Levine of [[Digital Spy]] gave "Sexy Bitch" a three star rating, expressing some discontent towards the lyrical content but cited the hook and beats as factors that make the song "bearable".{{cite web|last=Levine|first=Nick|title=David Guetta ft. Akon: 'Sexy Bitch'|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/music/singlesreviews/a172143/david-guetta-ft-akon-sexy-bitch.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=28 May 2012|date=August 18, 2009}} In the review of ''One Love'' for the same publication, David Balls offered a less optimistic view of the song, calling it "a throwaway affair with a sell-by-date to rival a pint of milk."{{cite web|last=Balls|first=David|title=David Guetta: One Love|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/music/albumreviews/a173667/david-guetta-one-love.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=28 May 2012|date=August 26, 2009}} David Jeffries of [[AllMusic]] noted it as one of the album's highlights, writing that "Akon and guilty pleasure lyrics ... make for a perfect match."{{cite web|last=Jeffries|first=David|title=One Love - David Guetta|url=http://www.allmusic.com/album/one-love-r1626424/review|publisher=[[AllMusic]]|accessdate=28 May 2012}} Eric Lyndal Martin of ''[[PopMatters]]'' commented, "the final product makes you wonder just how sexy this bitch actually is," and commended the track for its driving beats, writing that they "make this song a lot of fun."{{cite web|last=Martin|first=Eric lyndal|title=David Guetta: One Love|url=http://www.popmatters.com/pm/review/110587-david-guetta-one-love/|work=[[PopMatters]]|accessdate=28 May 2012|date=September 15, 2009}} ==Chart performance== [[File:David Guetta One Love Tour México.jpg|thumb|220px|left|"Sexy Bitch" earned Guetta his first top five single in the United States and stands as his second highest charting single there.]]"Sexy Bitch" was released as the follow up single to "[[When Love Takes Over]]", which was experiencing international success during the time of the single's release. It proved to surpass "When Love Takes Over" in the United States when it debuted on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] at number 56 on the week ending 15 August 2009, becoming Guetta's highest peaking single on the chart at the time. The song reappeared on the Hot 100 following the single's release to [[Contemporary hit radio|mainstream]] and [[Rhythmic crossover|rhythmic crossover radio]]. Within months, the song entered the top 10 tier, where it ascended and descended until 13 February 2010, when it peaked at number five.{{cite web|title=David Guetta Album & Song History (Billboard Hot 100)|url={{BillboardURLbyName|artist=david guetta|chart=all}}|work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|accessdate=31 May 2012}} "Sexy Bitch" exited the ''Billboard'' Hot 100 after 40 weeks, and earned a double-platinum certification by the [[Recording Industry Association of America]] (RIAA) on 11 February 2010 and a triple-platinum certification on 9 July 2012.{{cite web|title=American single certifications - Guetta, David - Sexy Bitch|url=https://www.riaa.com/goldandplatinumdata.php?artist=%22Sexy+Bitch%22|work=[[Recording Industry Association of America]]|accessdate=31 May 2012}} It has amassed sales of 3,507,000 digital downloads in the United States by March 2014.{{cite web|last=Grein|first=Paul|url=https://music.yahoo.com/blogs/music-news/chart-watch-soko-why-she-9-235003194.html|title=Chart Watch: Who Is Soko And Why Is She #9?|publisher=Yahoo Music|date=March 19, 2014|accessdate=March 30, 2014}} In Canada, the song debuted on the [[Canadian Hot 100]] at number nine, becoming the week's "highest debut". It fell down the chart up until its fourth week, when it hit number 35.{{cite web|title=David Guetta and Akon - Sexy Bitch|url=http://acharts.us/song/47179|work=acharts|publisher=acharts.us|accessdate=31 May 2012}} The song got its "second wind" in its fifth week, rising to number 21, and eventually reached the [[Canadian Hot 100 number-one hits of 2009|summit of the chart]], where it stalled for two weeks.{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/charts/2009-10-03/canadian-hot-100|title=Canadian Hot 100 – Week of October 3, 2009|date=2009-10-03|accessdate=2009-09-25|work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]}} "Sexy Bitch" replicated the chart success of the previous single in international territories. In the Australasian countries, it reached the summit of the singles charts in Australia and New Zealand. However, the song was more successful in Australia, where it logged the top position for seven weeks and lasted on the chart for 38 weeks.{{cite web|title=australian-charts.com - David Guetta feat. Akon - Sexy Bitch|url=http://www.australian-charts.com/showitem.asp?interpret=David+Guetta+feat%2E+Akon&titel=Sexy+Bitch&cat=s|publisher=australian-charts.com|accessdate=31 May 2012}} The song earned a quintuple-platinum certification by the [[Australian Recording Industry Association]] (ARIA), denoting shipments of 350,000 copies.{{cite web |url=http://www.aria.com.au/pages/httpwww.aria.com.aupageshttpwww.aria.com.aupageshttpwww.aria.com.aupagesARIACharts-Accr.htm |title=ARIA Charts – Accreditations – 2009 Singles |publisher=[[Australian Recording Industry Association]] |date=December 31, 2009 |accessdate=August 31, 2010}} In New Zealand, "Sexy Bitch" lasted three weeks at number one and 23 weeks on the chart.{{cite web|title=charts.org.nz - David Guetta feat. Akon - Sexy Bitch|url=http://charts.org.nz/showitem.asp?interpret=David+Guetta+feat%2E+Akon&titel=Sexy+Bitch&cat=s|publisher=charts.org.nz|accessdate=31 May 2012}} The song shipped 30,000 copies to the country, earning a double platinum certification by the [[Recording Industry Association of New Zealand]] (RIANZ).{{cite web|url=http://www.radioscope.net.nz/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=77&Itemid=63 |title=Latest Gold / Platinum Singles |publisher=RadioScope |date=August 29, 2010 |accessdate=August 31, 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081014104613/http://www.radioscope.net.nz/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=77&Itemid=63 |archivedate=October 14, 2008 |df= }} "Sexy Bitch" showed similar standings in the European countries, continuing Guetta's mainstream success around the world. The song topped the charts in four countries and reached the top five in nine. In the United Kingdom, it entered the [[UK Singles Chart|singles chart]] at number 21 on 21 August 2009.{{cite web|title=ChartArchive - The Black Eyed Peas - My Humps|url=http://www.theofficialcharts.com/search-results-album/_/My+Humps#single|work=Chart Archive|accessdate=29 May 2012}} The song rose to number one in the following week and lasted 40 weeks on the chart, amassing sales of 740,000 copies in the United Kingdom. "Sexy Bitch" showed the most longevity in Switzerland, where it logged 77 weeks on the [[Swiss Singles Chart|singles chart]]. The song reached a peak of number two, where it stalled for three consecutive weeks in October 2009. It eventually earned a quadruple-platinum certification by [[International Federation of the Phonographic Industry|International Federation of the Phonographic Industry Switzerland]] (IFPI Switzerland), denoting shipments of 80,000 copies.{{cite web|title=David Guetta feat. Akon - Sexy Bitch - hitparade.ch|url=http://hitparade.ch/showitem.asp?interpret=David+Guetta+feat%2E+Akon&titel=Sexy+Bitch&cat=s|work=hitparade.ch|publisher=Hung Medien|accessdate=31 May 2012}} "Sexy Bitch" experienced a successful chart run in Sweden, entering the [[Sweden Singles Chart|singles chart]] at number eight and after more than two months, reached a peak at number two.{{cite web|title=swedishcharts.com - David Guetta feat. Akon - Sexy Bitch|url=http://swedishcharts.com/showitem.asp?interpret=David+Guetta+feat%2E+Akon&titel=Sexy+Bitch&cat=s|publisher=swedishcharts.com|accessdate=31 May 2012}} The song lasted 55 weeks on the chart, 25 of which were spent inside the top 10. In Austria, the song reached the summit of the [[Austrian Singles Chart|singles chart]], where it stayed for three consecutive weeks.{{cite web|title=David Guetta feat. Akon - Sexy Bitch|url=http://austriancharts.at/showitem.asp?interpret=David+Guetta+feat%2E+Akon&titel=Sexy+Bitch&cat=s|work=austriancharts.at|publisher=Hung Medien|accessdate=31 May 2012}} ==Music video== [[File:Sexy bitch david guetta and akon.jpg||left|202px|thumb|Akon wakes up to find a message made of lipstick that says "find me at the pool party" and a photo.]] The video was directed by Stephen Schuster. The video starts with a plane coming and girls in bikinis are seen tanning and swimming. The camera switches to [[Akon]] who wakes up and finds pictures of his date from David Guetta's pool party. He then finds lipstick note on his mirror that reads "find me at pool party" with yet another photo. As the party starts, people enter; a group of teenage boys are not allowed but they employ various methods to get in. The camera switches to Akon again, who is shown singing underwater. The camera flicks to Guetta arriving meeting up with Akon, who then grabs Guetta and they throw each other in the pool. The party continues as Akon pushes more people in, girls dance and Akon with Guetta are shown to be having a water fight. The scene then skips to a club that is called "Fuck Me, I'm Famous" where [[David Guetta]] is performing a concert with [[Tocadisco]], and Akon is walking in from the back, where he meets some girls. Akon then arrives and performs "Sexy Bitch" at the concert. A light up man in blue and green appears. Girls are shown dancing and Akon does a crowd surf before the video ends. At the end, Akon is seen sleeping in the bed waking up finding pictures but goes back to sleep. The video was filmed in [[Ibiza]], [[Barcelona]], Spain, and [[Swindon]], England around 27 July 2009.{{cite web|url=http://buzzworthy.mtv.com/2009/09/23/new-ish-video-david-guetta-featuring-akon-sexy-chick/ |title=New(-ish) Video: David Guetta Featuring Akon, ‘Sexy Chick’ » MTV Buzzworthy Blog |publisher=MTV |date=2009-09-23 |accessdate=2010-08-31}} An alternate version for a censored version of the song ("Sexy Chick") depicts two girls in Akon's bedroom; one is taking Polaroid photos of the other. They even take photos of themselves in Akon's bed while he sleeps. Akon's bed is covered in photos, and as the girls leave, the one most heavily photographed writes in lipstick on the bathroom mirror, "find me at pool party". She attaches another photo and leaves a lipstick impression of her lips on the mirror before she goes to the pool party. Akon then wakes up. The rest of the video is much like the other version, with a few scenes cut or added at the pool party and the club. For example, the underwater singing scene is omitted. ===Controversy=== On 24 March 2010, Buddhist groups in [[Sri Lanka]] have stated the music video was offensive to [[Buddhism]], due to the fact that the Buddha statue is found in several shots in the background throughout. With protests held along with demanding a concert cancellation, the Sri Lankan Government prohibited Akon from entering Sri Lanka with a visa.{{cite web|url=http://adaderana.lk/news.php?nid=7584|title=No Visa to Akon|publisher=Ada Derana News|date=March 23, 2010}} In response, Akon said "I was not aware that the statue was even on the set of the video until now. I would never set out to offend or desecrate anyone’s religion or religious beliefs... I myself am a spiritual man, so I can understand why they are offended, but violence is never the answer and I am disheartened."{{cite web|url=http://www.vibe.com/2010/03/akon-responds-sexy-bitch-protests/|title=Akon Responds To ‘Sexy Bitch’ Protests|work=Vibe|date=March 24, 2010}} ==Credits and personnel== * Songwriting — [[Giorgio Tuinfort]], [[Akon|Aliaume Thiam]], [[David Guetta]], Jean-Claude Sindres, [[Sandy Vee]] * Production — David Guetta, Jean-Claude Sindres, Sandy Vee Credits adapted from the liner notes of ''One Love'', [[Virgin Records]], [[EMI|EMI France]].{{cite AV media notes|others=Fergie|title=[[The Dutchess]]|year=2006|type= inlay cover|publisher= [[A&M Records]], [[will.i.am Music Group]] , [[Interscope Records]]}} ==Track listing== *'''UK CD single'''{{cite web|url=http://www.discogs.com/David-Guetta-Feat-Akon-Sexy-Bitch/release/1909794 |title=David Guetta Feat.
